pr_title: PLANNER-1950 ConstraintProvider tests for School Timetabling quickstarts

timeline.message: PLANNER-1950 Add constraint provider test to quarkus-school-timetabling-quickstart
PLANNER-1950 Add constraint provider test to spring-boot-school-timetabling-quickstart

timeline.author: Christopher-Chianelli

replies.bodyText:
Since JUnit 5, it needn't be. And I would argue it shouldn't be, as it doesn't export anything to any other class, nor does it need to be visible.
Most of Optaplanner code makes the test class public. However, the constraint provider in facility maintenance quickstart already doesn't. So, faced with a choice, I picked the rule that was closer and made more sense.
replies.author: triceo

timeline.bodyText: In a real project, this constructor would deserve a documentation explaining how long a timeslot it creates if you do not provide an end time. Not sure if it's worth it for the quickstart. Your call.
timeline.author: yurloc

replies.bodyText: The end time doesn't really matter anyways; all that matter if time slots are exactly the same or not (the constraints do not check for overlap of time slots, but equality of time slots)
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli

replies.bodyText: (actually, it does matter for one constraint - teacherTimeEfficiency and studentGroupSubjectVariety, where we check for > 30 minutes gaps). There is an implict assumption that timeslots do not overlap
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli

replies.bodyText: Considering that this would be the only Javadoc in the entire project, I decided against it. Merging.
replies.author: triceo
